s.text: California does have a strong network of legal aid organizations that try to help meet the needs of the poor, but there's just one legal aid lawyer available per 10,000 poor people.
California does have a strong network of legal aid organizations that try to help meet the needs of the poor, but there's just one legal aid lawyer available per 10,000 poor people.
More funding and more resources for legal services for the poor must be a statewide priority.
California does have a strong network of legal aid organizations that try to help meet the needs of the poor, but there's just one legal aid lawyer available per 10,000 poor people.
California does have a strong network of legal aid organizations that try to help meet the needs of the poor, but there's just one legal aid lawyer available per 10,000 poor people.
More funding and more resources for legal services for the poor must be a statewide priority.

The Commission on Access to Justice says that government investment would have to triple to match the investment made by comparable states and the combined public/private investment must reach $533 million to adequately meet the legal needs of the poor.

The statistics might seem cold, but it's impossib le to remain complacent after meeting someone like Katherine -- or a family who has been left homeless by an illegal eviction, a senior who lost his home to foreclosure from a crooked loan transaction, or a domestic violence victim unable to navigate the courts to get a restraining order.

The Commission on Access to Justice says that government investment would have to triple to match the investment made by comparable states and the combined public/private investment must reach $533 million to adequately meet the legal needs of the poor.

And democratic governments throughout the world have recognized that government funding for lawyers is as critical to a fair legal system as are judges, courts and laws.
